description: Airing on Monday, May 18, 2015: First up on today's show, Jonathan Zittrain, co-founder of Harvard’s Berkman Center for Internet and Society, joins to to talk about giving people the choice to opt out of being recorded in public on livestreaming apps like Meerkat and Periscope. Plus, Ryan Calo, Assistant Law Professor at the University of Washington and an affiliate scholar at the Stanford Center for Internet and Society, talks about testing Google’s driverless cars. And we'll talk with Martha Sorren, TV Editor at Bustle, about using social media to predict who will win this season of The Bachelorette.

And we'll talk with Martha Sorren, TV Editor at Bustle, about using social media to predict who will win this season of The Bachelorette.
title: Marketplace Tech for Monday, May 18, 2015
